episodes.title: Bonus Episode 2: The Psychology of Joining and Leaving a Cult
episodes.description:
Josh speaks to Alexandra Stein, an expert on the psychology of joining and leaving ideologically extremist groups. Stein is a cult survivor and author of "Terror, Love and Brainwashing: Attachment in cults and totalitarian systems".


About Escaping NXIVM: NXIVM calls itself a humanitarian community. Experts call it a cult. Uncover: Escaping NXIVM is an investigative podcast series about the group, its leader Keith Raniere and one woman's journey to get out. 

🎧 More Escaping NXIVM episodes: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLuMdLmjdG8dfyp_8268yNFa_0mgFV8plc
✨ Like this podcast? You might like Crime Story. Listen here https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLuMdLmjdG8dfrpU_PKftMAFxzenopipsO
👉 Subscribe for more: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8rLel5fzQV-pN7pUOF31gQ?sub_confirmation=1

This podcast is part of the CBC Podcasts family. Find this podcast and others at https://cbc.ca/podcasts

Thank you for listening

episodes.title: Bonus Episode 1: The Fright Experiments | Escaping NXIVM
episodes.description:
Jennifer Kobelt — Sarah Edmondson's former assistant in NXIVM — tells her story of joining NXIVM at a moment of crisis in her life and being involved in the group’s so-called "fright study.”


About Escaping NXIVM: NXIVM calls itself a humanitarian community. Experts call it a cult. Uncover: Escaping NXIVM is an investigative podcast series about the group, its leader Keith Raniere and one woman's journey to get out.

episodes.title: A Conversation With Sarah Edmondson & Anthony Ames About Escaping NXIVM & Mental Health: Sickboy Podcast
episodes.description: Sarah Edmondson and Anthony "Nippy" Ames are cult escapees and whistleblowers featured in Escaping NXIVM. In this clip from the Sickboy podcast, Sarah and Nippy sit down with the Sickboy hosts to dive deep into their experience with escaping a cult and how it affected their mental health. The full interview and more episodes are available at smarturl.it/sickboycbc

episodes.title: The rise and fall of NXIVM's Keith Raniere
episodes.description: In a U.S. federal courtroom Tuesday, Keith Raniere was sentenced to 120 years—having been convicted of a slew of crimes related to his alleged sex cult NXIVM. During the trial and sentencing, victims told of how the self-professed empowerment "vanguard" had turned some of his followers into sex slaves and branded them with his initials. Front Burner's Jayme Poisson discusses with Uncover: NXIVM host Josh Bloch.

episodes.title: Episode 1: The Branding
episodes.description: Sarah Edmondson is a high-level member of a self-help group called NXIVM, but an invitation to join a secret women's group called DOS leads her to do something she later regrets.

episodes.title: Episode 7: The Reckoning
episodes.description: Sarah faces criticism about her role in NXIVM and tries to come to terms with the 12 years she spent as a high-level member of the group.

episodes.title: Episode 6: The Defence
episodes.description: Josh speaks to one of Keith Raniere's lawyers, Marc Agnifilo, and hears a different point of view on NXIVM and DOS.

episodes.title: Episode 5: Blow it Up
episodes.description: Sarah and her husband try to escape NXIVM and take it down while warning others who are still inside.

episodes.title: Episode 4: The Suppressives
episodes.description: What happens when you leave NXIVM? Those who have left or spoken out reveal the price they paid.

episodes.title: Episode 3: Sex, Money and Nazis
episodes.description: Those who knew Keith Raniere intimately reveal his early life, how he started NXIVM and ended up being accused by the FBI of running a criminal enterprise.

episodes.title: Episode 2: The Epiphany
episodes.description: Sarah takes us inside her journey with NXIVM, from signing up for a personal growth workshop to becoming a star recruiter for the group she now calls a cult.
